label: L1
name: Operate & Control Flight
description: Provides all systems needed to control aircraft motion, attitude, navigation, and balance in flight. Includes manual and automatic control of flight path, flight surfaces, thrust, and position—across all flight phases and aircraft types.

label: L2
name: Control Flight Path
description: Automates trajectory, speed, and load management via autopilot, autothrottle, trim, and ride-control functions, keeping the aircraft on the commanded course and profile.

label: L2
name: Control Aircraft Attitude
description: Gives pilots direct manual authority over all fixed-wing control surfaces—ailerons, elevators, rudder, flaps, spoilers, leading-edge devices—to set and hold the desired roll, pitch, and yaw.

label: L2
name: Provide Navigation
description: Generates, fuses, and displays position, guidance, and flight-environment data—independent or radio/SAT aided—to steer, update, and optimize the aircraft’s route from take-off to taxi.

label: L2
name: Control Aircraft Balance
description: Stores, transfers, dumps, and monitors water ballast to shift the center of gravity and maintain stable flight balance when required.

label: L2
name: Control Helicopter Attitude
description: Enables collective, cyclic, tail-rotor, and servo controls that let the pilot command helicopter pitch, roll, and yaw through precise rotor-blade angle and thrust changes.

label: L1
name: Generate & Manage Propulsion
description: Provides all systems required to produce, control, and support engine thrust and rotor lift. Includes fuel, air, ignition, lubrication, exhaust, starting, and power augmentation systems, as well as control and monitoring of engine and propeller/rotor operation across all propulsion types and aircraft classes.

label: L2
name: Manage Fuel Supply
description: Stores, transfers, dumps, and gauges fuel from airframe tanks to the engine feed point.

label: L2
name: Maintain Propeller Integrity
description: Inspects, repairs, and applies standard practices to keep propellers and rotors structurally sound.

label: L2
name: Provide Propulsor Control
description: Adjusts propeller pitch, speed, braking, and vector ducts, while reporting propulsor status.

label: L2
name: Provide Helicopter Lift
description: Generates primary lift through main rotor blades, head, shaft, and swashplate systems.

label: L2
name: Transmit Helicopter Power
description: Carries engine torque to the main rotor via couplings, shafts, clutches, and gearboxes.

label: L2
name: Provide Helicopter Yaw Control
description: Uses tail-rotor blades and head to counter main-rotor torque and steer yaw, with status sensing.

label: L2
name: Transmit Tail Rotor Power
description: Delivers power to the tail rotor through drive shafts and gearboxes, with health indication.

label: L2
name: Support Helicopter Configuration
description: Folds and unfolds rotor blades and tail pylon—manual or automatic—for compact storage.

label: L2
name: Provide Propulsion
description: Operates turbine or reciprocating engines, covering all core sections, drives, and propulsor hardware.

label: L2
name: Manage Engine Fuel
description: Meters, distributes, and monitors fuel from quick-disconnect to engine nozzles and augmentors.

label: L2
name: Ignite Fuel Mixture
description: Generates, routes, and controls high-energy ignition to start and sustain combustion.

label: L2
name: Manage Engine Airflow
description: Controls bleed, anti-ice, cooling, and compressor flow paths and reports air-system status.

label: L2
name: Control Engine Operation
description: Provides cockpit power levers, linkages, and emergency-shutdown controls for the engine.

label: L2
name: Monitor Engine Performance
description: Senses, analyzes, and displays thrust, temperature, and integrated engine parameters to crew.

label: L2
name: Manage Engine Exhaust
description: Collects, directs, muffles, reverses, and modulates exhaust flow and supplementary air.

label: L2
name: Lubricate Engine
description: Stores, circulates, and monitors oil to protect and cool engine bearings and gears.

label: L2
name: Start Engine
description: Drives starters and crank systems to bring the engine up to self-sustaining speed.

label: L2
name: Augment Reciprocating Engine Performance
description: Recovers exhaust energy with power-recovery turbines and turbo-superchargers for added output.

label: L2
name: Augment Engine Power
description: Injects metered water into the induction path to boost thrust and monitors water status.

label: L2
name: Provide Additional Thrust
description: Supplies short-duration auxiliary propulsion (e.g., JATO) independent of the main engines.

label: L1
name: Generate & Distribute On-Board Energy
description: Provides all systems that generate, convert, store, control, and distribute energy to aircraft systems. Includes electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic, vacuum, and auxiliary power systems, along with accessory gearboxes that power engine-driven systems.

label: L2
name: Provide Electrical Power
description: Generates, converts, connects, and routes AC and DC power—from generators, batteries, or ground—through aircraft buses to every electrical load.

label: L2
name: Provide Hydraulic Power
description: Pressurizes, stores, and delivers main and standby hydraulic fluid to all using systems, with continuous quantity-temperature-pressure monitoring.

label: L2
name: Provide Pneumatic Power
description: Supplies and controls high- or low-pressure compressed air to downstream systems and tracks system temperatures and pressures.

label: L2
name: Provide Vacuum Power
description: Creates, distributes, and monitors negative-pressure air for systems that rely on vacuum.

label: L2
name: Provide Auxiliary Power
description: Runs the APU to furnish independent electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic power, managing its fuel, start, control, exhaust, and cooling functions.

label: L2
name: Power Engine Accessories
description: Transfers engine torque through remote gearboxes and shafts to drive multiple aircraft accessories and manages their lubrication and cooling.

label: L1
name: Protect & Preserve Aircraft Integrity
description: Provides all systems and structures that maintain the aircraft’s physical integrity and safety. Includes fire and ice protection, structural design and repair, fuel tank inerting, and compartment enclosures, covering both prevention and response across environmental and operational threats.

label: L2
name: Support Airframe Integrity
description: Applies standard airframe practices to inspect, service, and keep the basic structure safe and airworthy.

label: L2
name: Protect Against Fire
description: Detects fire or smoke and deploys extinguishing agents to suppress fires and stop fuel-vent explosions.

label: L2
name: Protect Against Ice and Rain
description: Prevents, removes, and monitors ice, frost, and rain on aerodynamic surfaces, inlets, sensors, and lines.

label: L2
name: Enhance Fuel Tank Safety
description: Inerts fuel tanks with nitrogen or other gas, distributing and controlling flow to minimize explosion risk.

label: L2
name: Maintain Structural Integrity
description: Inspects, repairs, and manages fuselage, wing, tail, and control-surface structures—materials, joints, damage, and bonding—to preserve strength and contour.

label: L1
name: Provide Life-Support & Cabin Services
description: Provides all systems that support occupant health, comfort, and usability of the aircraft interior. Includes air supply, pressurization, lighting, oxygen, water, waste, seating, furnishings, in-flight services, and emergency equipment for passengers and crew during all flight phases.

label: L2
name: Maintain Cabin Environment
description: Pressurizes, heats, cools, filters, and routes air to keep cabin pressure, temperature, and air quality within limits.

label: L2
name: Support Cabin Configuration
description: Outfits flight deck, passenger, galley, lavatory, cargo, and accessory areas with seats, fixtures, insulation, and emergency gear.

label: L2
name: Provide Illumination
description: Delivers interior, exterior, and emergency lighting for crew operations, passenger comfort, and ground visibility.

label: L2
name: Provide Oxygen Supply
description: Stores, regulates, and distributes oxygen for crew, passengers, and portable use during normal and emergency situations.

label: L2
name: Manage Water and Waste
description: Supplies potable and wash water, handles waste collection and flushing, and pressurizes tanks for reliable flow.

label: L3
name: ENABLE WATER AND WASTE SYSTEM OPERATION

label: L2
name: Provide Cabin Services
description: Runs cabin systems for entertainment, connectivity, and centralized cabin management functions.

label: L1
name: Sense, Communicate & Manage Information
description: Provides all systems that collect, display, transmit, and manage information across the aircraft. Includes communication systems, flight and maintenance data monitoring, avionics integration, health diagnostics, and onboard digital information services for crew, maintenance, and passengers.

label: L2
name: Monitor Helicopter Health
description: Tracks vibration and noise signatures to pinpoint rotor or airframe imbalance, misalignment, or damage.

label: L2
name: Provide Aircraft Communication
description: Delivers voice and data links—intercom, PA, HF/VHF/UHF, SATCOM, passenger entertainment, and security audio/video—between crew, passengers, other aircraft, and ground.

label: L2
name: Provide Aircraft Monitoring
description: Displays, records, integrates, and warns on flight and system data, then transmits selected parameters to ground stations.

label: L2
name: Integrate Avionics Systems
description: Runs the core processing and network backbone that ties modular avionics functions and buses into a unified architecture.

label: L2
name: Monitor Aircraft Health
description: Uses the central maintenance system to collect diagnostics and isolate faults across structures, systems, propellers, and powerplant.

label: L2
name: Provide Information Services
description: Stores and distributes digital manuals, flight-deck data, maintenance references, and passenger information through onboard servers and displays.

label: L1
name: Ground & Maintenance Support
description: Provides all systems, structures, and documentation needed to operate, inspect, maintain, transport, service, and store the aircraft. Includes support for ground operations, maintenance checks, lifting, towing, weighing, powerplant integration, access systems, placards, and technical references required to keep the aircraft airworthy and service-ready.

label: L2
name: Support Aircraft Documentation
description: Maintains all reference manuals, dimensional charts, and system cross-reference diagrams required for ground and line crews.

label: L2
name: Support Aircraft Maintenance
description: Defines time limits, inspection schedules, lifting/jacking, and routine or unscheduled servicing procedures to keep the aircraft airworthy.

label: L2
name: Support Aircraft Balance
description: Levels, weighs, and records weight-and-balance data to ensure the aircraft meets CG limits after maintenance or modification.

label: L2
name: Support Ground Handling Procedures
description: Enables safe ground movement of the aircraft via towing, taxiing, and stabilization procedures—covering equipment use and limitations, but excluding operation of landing-gear, braking, and steering systems.

label: L2
name: Support Aircraft Storage
description: Covers parking, mooring, long- or short-term storage, and return-to-service steps for all environmental conditions.

label: L2
name: Support Aircraft Identification
description: Manages placards, markings, labels, and color schemes for safety, servicing, and regulatory compliance.

label: L2
name: Provide Access and Enclosure
description: Maintains doors, stairs, windows, and status-indication systems for crew, passenger, cargo, and service entry points.

label: L2
name: Support Powerplant Installation
description: Handles nacelle and pylon structure, mounts, cowling, seals, and attach fittings needed to install or remove engines.

label: L2
name: Provide Visibility and Access
description: Manages flight-deck, passenger, door, and inspection windows and windshields for clarity and structural integrity.

label: L2
name: Support Engine Maintenance
description: Applies standard engine maintenance practices and procedures across all powerplant types.

label: L2
name: Support Power Plant Integration
description: Covers engine change, run-up, mounts, air inlets, drains, wiring harnesses, and other systems that tie the powerplant into the airframe.

label: L1
name: Operate Landing Gear & Braking
description: Controls the deployment, retraction, steering, braking, and status indication of landing gear systems to support takeoff, landing, and ground manoeuvres.

label: L2
name: Operate Landing Gear
description: Deploys and stows the main and nose/tail gear assemblies

label: L2
name: Control Braking & Steering
description: Controls braking, anti-skid, wheel rotation, and ground steering functions to ensure safe and precise movement during taxi, takeoff, landing, and rollout.
